intro: Erigeron venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron venezuelensis is often found in low-lying areas and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
